Title:
A new species of penzigioid Xylaria from the Cloud Forest in
Eastern Mexico revealed through morphology and phylogenetic
analysis
Keywords:
Ascomycota, DNA sequences, Phylogeny, Taxonomy,
Xylariales
Abstract:
A new species with penzigioid stromata was collected in a
montane cloud forest from Eastern Mexico. Xylaria subtropicalis is
described and illustrated based on morphological characters and DNA
sequences data. This new species differ morphologically from the other
penzigioid xylarias by the shape and size of the stroma, which is joined
to the substrate by a narrow central connective and by the size and type
of germ slit spores. Phylogenetic analysis based on nuc rDNA
ITS1-5.8S-ITS2 (ITS), and segments of the 28S and the second largest
subunit of RNA polymerase II (RPB2), indicated that this novel specie
formed a strongly supported monophyletic group clearly separated from
other species of Xylaria. Illustrations of detailed macro-and
microscopic morphology are also presented.
